rows.title: Feel your feelings

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes.

Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?

Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
It is ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?

rows.transcript:
Close your eyes.

Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?

Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
It is ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?

text_1.eng: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day. It starts with recognising how you feel.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: We all have days where we just don’t know. That is okay! You are here and that is what matters.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Being a parent can be hard. But you are here and that shows you want to keep improving things. That is a big accomplishment already!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about teen safety.

Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe.

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!

media_title.eng: How will it help me and my family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.

rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Communication is the most important thing!

Let's see what happened with @data.characters.female_caregiver_3.name and @data.characters.female_child_1.name:

character_1_text.eng: Something happened when I was out with my friends @data.characters.female_child_4.name and @data.characters.female_child_5.name!

media_title.eng:
Hear a caregiver's testimonial

Placeholder text - Anna - we need a title similar to the above row

media_transcript.eng:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.

rows.media_transcript:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.
rows.character_1_text: Something happened when I was out with my friends @data.characters.female_child_4.name and @data.characters.female_child_5.name!

character_1_text.eng: Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what is your name?

rows.character_1_text: Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what is your name?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you will be back in time, I promise…

character_2_text.eng: I am not sure if that is a good idea…

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.female_child_1.name, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you will be back in time, I promise…
rows.character_2_text: I am not sure if that is a good idea…

character_1_text.eng: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I am telling you, if you do not do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!

rows.character_1_text: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I am telling you, if you do not do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name do not go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you do not know. Besides, he is too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.female_child_1.name do not go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you do not know. Besides, he is too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.

character_1_text.eng: Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!

rows.character_1_text: Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened to @data.characters.female_child_1.name:

quiz_1_question.eng: What was risky about that situation?

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: Going with an older man puts @data.characters.female_child_1.name in a dangerous situation where she can get hurt or be forced to do things

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: Many girls in our communities get pregnant or catch HIV from older men

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: There were no other trusted adults to advise @data.characters.female_child_1.name

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's look at another example of a dangerous situation together.

character_1_text.eng: My friend has been talking with a guy our age online... She is going to send him photos of herself. Is that better because he is our age?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's look at another example of a dangerous situation together.
rows.character_1_text: My friend has been talking with a guy our age online... She is going to send him photos of herself. Is that better because he is our age?

character_1_text.eng:
You are a good friend for being worried about her. Sending sexy photos is a real risk too.

Sometimes people are not who they say they are online – he could say he is your age but be a 50-year-old man. Or when they break up, he could send those photos to everyone and your friend would feel awful.

rows.character_1_text:
You are a good friend for being worried about her. Sending sexy photos is a real risk too.

Sometimes people are not who they say they are online – he could say he is your age but be a 50-year-old man. Or when they break up, he could send those photos to everyone and your friend would feel awful.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Question time. 

Let's think about our teens' online safety.

quiz_1_question.eng: What is the biggest online risk for teens these days?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: Adults use social media, gaming and messaging apps and websites to meet teenagers and persuade them to do sexual things

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: People put things online to make us hurt other people - like making violence seem cool, or hating people from another race or country

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: People put things online to persuade teenagers to hurt themselves or commit suicide

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: Teenagers share sexy videos or photos or information about themselves, and people show it to others or use it to upset them

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: People can often be nasty to teenagers online - they feel like they can bully people safely

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

text_1_facilitator.eng:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand the dangerous situations they could get into! 

Let’s make two maps together of safe and unsafe places:

- A map of our community
- A map of apps/websites we use online

You will do the same with your teen as home practice this week - if your teen is here now, you can do it together now!

quiz_1_question.eng: Placeholder text for question: E.g., Can your family join you in this activity?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: My family can join in now!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Let me try it out by myself

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Placeholder text need content for feedback

rows.text_1_facilitator:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand the dangerous situations they could get into! 

Let’s make two maps together of safe and unsafe places:

- A map of our community
- A map of apps/websites we use online

You will do the same with your teen as home practice this week - if your teen is here now, you can do it together now!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 1: What are important places in your community?

text_2.eng:
- Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
- Draw a map of your teen’s community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 1: What are important places in your community?
rows.text_2:
- Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
- Draw a map of your teen’s community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 2: Which places are safe and unsafe?

text_2.eng:
- Which areas on your map are safe for teenagers – CIRCLE these
- Which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers – CROSS those off
- What makes a place safe or unsafe?
- What could you and your teen do to keep your teen safer?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 2: Which places are safe and unsafe?
rows.text_2:
- Which areas on your map are safe for teenagers – CIRCLE these
- Which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers – CROSS those off
- What makes a place safe or unsafe?
- What could you and your teen do to keep your teen safer?

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 3: Where can you get support?

text_2.eng:
Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.

- Where can you and your teen get support when you face a crisis? – MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper.vvvvvv

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 3: Where can you get support?
rows.text_2:
Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.

- Where can you and your teen get support when you face a crisis? – MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper.vvvvvv

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 4: What are risky places online and how can you make them safer?

text_2.eng:
- Draw pictures of the apps and websites your teenagers use
- Recognise how good they are at using the web!
- Think about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
- What could you and your teen do to make using the internet safer for your teen and their friends?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 4: What are risky places online and how can you make them safer?
rows.text_2:
- Draw pictures of the apps and websites your teenagers use
- Recognise how good they are at using the web!
- Think about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
- What could you and your teen do to make using the internet safer for your teen and their friends?

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week’s takeaway skills!

text_2.eng: How to keep your teen safe:

section_1_text.eng: Make maps with your teen of safe and unsafe areas in your community and online. Talk about how to keep their information, photos and videos private online. Talk about how once something goes online, it stays there forever. They might know an example from their friends.

section_2_extra_text.eng: Make rules with your teen about how they can stay safe in your community (especially in risky areas that cannot be avoided) and how they can safely use the apps and websites that they like.

section_3_extra_text.eng: Agree on a Safety Word. If something happens that makes your teen upset, uncomfortable or scared, they can say the Safety Word and you will help them without getting angry or punishing them, even if they were doing something wrong.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are this week’s takeaway skills!
rows.text_2: How to keep your teen safe:
rows.section_1_text: Make maps with your teen of safe and unsafe areas in your community and online. Talk about how to keep their information, photos and videos private online. Talk about how once something goes online, it stays there forever. They might know an example from their friends.
rows.section_2_extra_text: Make rules with your teen about how they can stay safe in your community (especially in risky areas that cannot be avoided) and how they can safely use the apps and websites that they like.
rows.section_3_extra_text: Agree on a Safety Word. If something happens that makes your teen upset, uncomfortable or scared, they can say the Safety Word and you will help them without getting angry or punishing them, even if they were doing something wrong.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice their module skills at home get better results.

If you have not done it together yet, make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places:

- Map of your community
- Map of apps and websites your teen uses

Make sure you are both happy with the safety plan.

What really matters is that you talk with your teen as you do this – often teens know much more than we do about where it is safe and unsafe!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice their module skills at home get better results.

If you have not done it together yet, make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places:

- Map of your community
- Map of apps and websites your teen uses

Make sure you are both happy with the safety plan.

What really matters is that you talk with your teen as you do this – often teens know much more than we do about where it is safe and unsafe!

media_title.eng:
Hear a teen's testimonial

PLACEHOLDER TEXT _ ANNA

media_transcript.eng:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot – also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!

rows.media_title:
Hear a teen's testimonial

PLACEHOLDER TEXT _ ANNA
rows.media_transcript:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot – also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!
